Package de.thm.mni.oop.fcanvas

Class FCanvas

java.lang.Object
de.thm.mni.oop.fcanvas.FCanvas
public class FCanvas extends Object

This class implements a canvas on which you can draw using static methods.

The class is essentially a wrapper for the functionality of the FCanvasPanel class, which provides a simplified interface without the additional Swing methods.

No knowledge of concurrency, GUI design, or objects is required to use the class. An understanding of arrays is also only required for the polygon methods.

Examples:

Draw and display a red circle:

 long o = drawOval(10,10,100,100);
 setFillColor(255,0,0);
 show();

Draw a sine wave with line width 3:

 int actual = 0;
 for(int i = 0; i < 200; i++) {
   int tmp = (int)Math.round(Math.sin(i/30.0)*200+300);
   long l = drawLine(i-1,lst,i,tmp);
   setStrokeWidth(l,3);
   lst = tmp;
 }

Change the color of a circle whenever the left or right arrow key was pressed (cancel with ESC):

 long id = drawOval(100,100,50,50);
 int interval = 30;
 while(isVisible()) {
   if(getKeyPressesSinceLastAsked(KeyEvent.VK_ESCAPE) > 0) break;
   if(getKeyPressesSinceLastAsked(KeyEvent.VK_LEFT) > 0) setFillColor(id,255,0,0);
   if(getKeyPressesSinceLastAsked(KeyEvent.VK_RIGHT) > 0) setFillColor(id,0,0,255);
   Thread.sleep(interval);
 }

  • Method Details

    • show

      public static void show()

      Shows the Canvas window.

      Graphic components can be added and modified both before and after calling this method.

      Caution: The running program cannot be terminated until the window has been closed by the user or by calling close().
      See Also:
      • close()

    • close

      public static void close()
      Closes the Canvas window. Once the window is closed, it cannot be reopened.

    • drawRectangle

      public static long drawRectangle(int left, int top, int width, int height)
      Draws a rectangle on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      left - x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle
      top - Y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle
      width - Width of the rectangle
      height - Height of the rectangle
      Returns:
      id of the created rectangle

    • drawLine

      public static long drawLine(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Draws a straight line between points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      x1 - x-coordinate of the first point
      y1 - y coordinate of the first point
      x2 - x-coordinate of the second point
      y2 - y coordinate of the second point
      Returns:
      id of the created line

    • drawOval

      public static long drawOval(int left, int top, int width, int height)
      Draws an oval on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      left - x-coordinate of the top left point of the oval's bounding box
      top - y-coordinate of the upper left point of the oval's bounding box
      width - Width of the oval
      height - Height of the oval
      Returns:
      id of the created oval

    • drawText

      public static long drawText(String text, int left, int baseline)
      Draws a text on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to draw
      left - the x-coordinate of the first character
      baseline - the y-coordinate of the baseline of the first character
      Returns:
      id of the created text

    • drawPolygon

      public static long drawPolygon(int[] xcoords, int[] ycoords)
      Draws a polygon on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      xcoords - array of x-coordinates of polygon points
      ycoords - array of y-coordinates of polygon points
      Returns:
      id of the created polygon

    • remove

      public static void remove(long id)
      Removes an object from the canvas.
      Parameters:
      id - id of the object to be removed
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing canvas object

    • move

      public static void move(long id, int x, int y)

      Moves an object on the canvas.

      The meaning of the x and y parameters differ depending on the type of object to be moved:

      • Ovals and Rectangles: (x,y) is the new top left point of the object.
      • Lines and polygons: (x,y) is the new coordinate of the first point of the object.
      • Text: x is the new x-coordinate of the first character, y is the new y-coordinate of the Baseline of the first character.
      Parameters:
      id - id of the object to be moved
      x - x-coordinate of the new origin point
      y - Y coordinate of the new origin point
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing canvas object

    • setFontSize

      public static void setFontSize(long id, int points)
      Changes the font size of a text object.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the text object
      points - the new font size in pt
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing text object

    • setStrokeWidth

      public static void setStrokeWidth(long id, int w)
      Changes the stroke width for the object. In the case of ovals, rectangles, lines and polygons, this means the width of the border. This method has no effect on text.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object
      w - the new stroke width (in pixels)
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing canvas object

    • setFillColor

      public static void setFillColor(long id, int r, int g, int b)
      Changes the fill color of an object. Has no effect on lines and text.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object
      r - value for the red channel (0 to 255)
      g - value for the green channel (0 to 255)
      b - value for the blue channel (0 to 255)
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing canvas object

    • setFillColor

      public static void setFillColor(long id, int r, int g, int b, int alpha)
      Changes the fill color of an object. Has no effect on lines and text.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object
      r - value for the red channel (0 to 255)
      g - value for the green channel (0 to 255)
      b - value for the blue channel (0 to 255)
      alpha - value for the alpha channel (0 to 255, 0 = transparent)
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing canvas object

    • setStrokeColor

      public static void setStrokeColor(long id, int r, int g, int b)
      Changes the stroke color of an object.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object
      r - value for the red channel (0 to 255)
      g - value for the green channel (0 to 255)
      b - value for the blue channel (0 to 255)
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing canvas object

    • setStrokeColor

      public static void setStrokeColor(long id, int r, int g, int b, int alpha)
      Changes the stroke color of an object. With alpha == 0 the bar becomes invisible.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object
      r - value for the red channel (0 to 255)
      g - value for the green channel (0 to 255)
      b - value for the blue channel (0 to 255)
      alpha - value for the alpha channel (0 to 255, 0 = transparent)
      Preconditions:
      id must belong to an existing canvas object

    • setRotation

      public static void setRotation(long id, float degrees)

      Changes the rotation angle for an object.

      Rectangles, ovals, lines and polygons are rotated around their center.

      Texts are rotated around their origin (left,baseline).

      Parameters:
      id - the id of the object
      degrees - rotation angle in degrees

    • setBackgroundColor

      public static void setBackgroundColor(int r, int g, int b)

      Changes the background color of the canvas.

      Parameters:
      r - value for the red channel (0 to 255)
      g - value for the green channel (0 to 255)
      b - value for the blue channel (0 to 255)

    • clear

      public static void clear()
      Removes all objects from the canvas.

    • update

      public static void update()

      Makes all changes to the canvas visible.

      Only required if the autoupdate function has been switched off.

      See Also:
      • setAutoUpdate(boolean)

    • setAutoUpdate

      public static void setAutoUpdate(boolean auto)

      Turns the autoupdate function on and off.

      If the feature is turned off, update() must be used before changes to the canvas become visible.

      Parameters:
      auto - if true autoupdate function is enabled, otherwise disabled
      See Also:
      • update()

    • wasKeyPressed

      public static boolean wasKeyPressed(int key, long since)

      Checks if the key was pressed since or less milliseconds ago.

      The key IDs can be found in the KeyEvent class.

      If two or more different keys were pressed in the specified time period, only the last one pressed will be recognized.

      Parameters:
      key - the ID of the key to check (e.g. KeyEvent.VK_0, KeyEvent.VK_ALT)
      since - Maximum number of milliseconds that may have elapsed since the key was pressed
      Returns:
      true if the selected key was pressed before since or less ms
      Since:
      1.1
      See Also:
      • KeyEvent

    • wasKeyPressedSinceLastAsked

      @Deprecated(since="1.3", forRemoval=true) public static boolean wasKeyPressedSinceLastAsked(int key)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      replaced with getKeyPressesSinceLastAsked(int)

      Checks if the key key has been pressed since the last time the same key was pressed using wasKeyPressed(int, long) or wasKeyPressedSinceLastAsked(int).

      For the first query, if neither method has been called yet, a default query time of 30 ms is used.

      Parameters:
      key - the ID of the key to check (e.g. KeyEvent.VK_0, KeyEvent.VK_ALT)
      Returns:
      true if the selected key has been pressed since the last query
      Since:
      1.2
      See Also:
      • KeyEvent

    • getKeyPressesSinceLastAsked

      public static int getKeyPressesSinceLastAsked(int key)

      The number of times the key has been pressed since the same key was queried with a call to this method.

      The first time this function is called, it returns the number of key presses since the program was started.

      Parameters:
      key - the ID of the key to check (e.g. KeyEvent.VK_0, KeyEvent.VK_ALT)
      Returns:
      Number of keystrokes with the key key since the last call
      Since:
      1.3
      See Also:
      • KeyEvent

    • wasMouseButtonPressed

      public static boolean wasMouseButtonPressed(int button, long since)

      Checks if the mouse button button was pressed since or less milliseconds ago.

      The IDs of the buttons can be found in the MouseEvent class.

      If two or more different keys were pressed in the specified time period, only the last one pressed will be recognized.

      Parameters:
      button - the ID of the button to check (e.g. MouseEvent.BUTTON1, MouseEvent.BUTTON3)
      since - Maximum number of milliseconds that may have elapsed since the key was pressed
      Returns:
      true if the selected key was pressed before since or less ms
      Since:
      1.1
      See Also:
      • MouseEvent

    • wasMouseButtonPressedSinceLastAsked

      @Deprecated(since="1.3", forRemoval=true) public static boolean wasMouseButtonPressedSinceLastAsked(int button)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      replaced with getMouseButtonPressesSinceLastAsked(int)

      Checks if the mouse button button has been pressed since the last time the same button was pressed using wasMouseButtonPressed(int, long) or wasMouseButtonPressedSinceLastAsked(int).

      For the first query, if neither method has been called yet, a default query time of 30 ms is used.

      Parameters:
      button - the ID of the button to check (e.g. MouseEvent.BUTTON1, MouseEvent.BUTTON3)
      Returns:
      true if the selected key has been pressed since the last query
      Since:
      1.2
      See Also:
      • MouseEvent

    • getMouseButtonPressesSinceLastAsked

      public static int getMouseButtonPressesSinceLastAsked(int button)

      The number of times the button mouse button has been pressed since the same key was queried with a call to this method.

      The first time this function is called, it returns the number of clicks since the program was started.

      Parameters:
      button - the ID of the button to check (e.g. MouseEvent.BUTTON1, MouseEvent.BUTTON3)
      Returns:
      Number of clicks of the mouse button button since the last call
      Since:
      1.3
      See Also:
      • MouseEvent

    • isVisible

      public static boolean isVisible()

      Indicates whether the Canvas window is currently visible.

      This method can be used, for example, to break an animation loop when the window is closed by the user.

      Returns:
      true if the window is visible, false otherwise

    • getCanvasWidth

      public static int getCanvasWidth()

      Returns:

      Since:

    • setCanvasSize

      public static void setCanvasSize(int w, int h)
      Changes the size of the drawing area.
      Parameters:
      w - the new width of the canvas
      h - the new height of the canvas
      Since:
      1.2

    • setAntialiasingEnabled

      public static void setAntialiasingEnabled(boolean enabled)

      Changes antialiasing settings.

      Antialiasing is turned off by default. It consumes more computing power, but gives the drawn objects smoother edges.

      Parameters:
      enabled - if true turns on antialiasing
      Since:
      1.2

    • saveToImage

      public static void saveToImage(String fname) throws IOException

      Saves the current graphic as an image file.

      The file name extension determines the storage format. Supported Formats are listed in the variable SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS. If an xtension is not supported, PNG is used by default.

      Parameters:
      fname - the name of the image file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file could not be written
      See Also:
      • SUPPORTED_IMAGE_FORMATS

    • setPixel

      public static void setPixel(int x, int y, int r, int g, int b)

      public static void setPixelBuffer(int x, int y)

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws InterruptedException
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
